Class EnhancedLinkedList

java.lang.Object
EnhancedLinkedList
public class EnhancedLinkedList extends Object
The EnhancedLinkedList class is the LinkedList representation that is made up of Node classes and methods to edit the LinkedList

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    (package private) static class 
    EnhancedLinkedList.Node
    The static class node was made a static class so that main can directly access it without having to instantiate the Node class.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private EnhancedLinkedList.Node
    head
    The Node instance variable head and tail serve as pointers to the head and tail of the LinkedList
    (package private) int
    size
    The int size is the number of Nodes that are contained in the LinkedList.
    private EnhancedLinkedList.Node
    tail
    The Node instance variable head and tail serve as pointers to the head and tail of the LinkedList

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    EnhancedLinkedList()
    The EnhancedLinkedList() constructor with no parameters sets the head and tail references to null and initializes the size instance variable to 0

    deleteAtFront()
    The deleteAtFront() method deletes the node at the back of the linked list
    void
    deleteAtIndex(int index)
    The deleteAtIndex() method makes use of helper functions deleteAtFront() and deleteAtBack() and defines the functionality to delete at other indexes.
    void

    The insertatBack() method inserts int newData at the back of the linked list
    void

    The insertAtFront() method inserts int newData at the front of the linked list.
    void
    insertAtIndex(int newData, int index)
    The insertAtIndex() method makes user of helper functions insertAtFront() and insertAtBack() but then defines the functionality to add a Node at a specified index and shifting the remaining nodes to the right

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      The overriden toString method creates the String representation of the EnchancedLinkedList class. It places the node's data instance vars in a comma seperated sentece.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:

    • insertAtBack

      public void insertAtBack(int newData)
      The insertatBack() method inserts int newData at the back of the linked list
      Parameters:
      newData - int new data to be added

    • insertAtFront

      public void insertAtFront(int newData)
      The insertAtFront() method inserts int newData at the front of the linked list.
      Parameters:
      newData - int new data to be added

    • deleteAtBack

      public void deleteAtBack()
      the deleteAtBack() method deletes the node at the back of the linkedlist

    • deleteAtFront

      public void deleteAtFront()
      The deleteAtFront() method deletes the node at the back of the linked list

    • insertAtIndex

      public void insertAtIndex(int newData, int index)
      The insertAtIndex() method makes user of helper functions insertAtFront() and insertAtBack() but then defines the functionality to add a Node at a specified index and shifting the remaining nodes to the right
      Parameters:
      newData - int new data that is to be added to the list
      index - the index of where the new Node should go in the linked lsit

    • deleteAtIndex

      public void deleteAtIndex(int index)
      The deleteAtIndex() method makes use of helper functions deleteAtFront() and deleteAtBack() and defines the functionality to delete at other indexes. It deletes the Node at the specified index and then shifts the nodes past the delted index to the left.
      Parameters:
      index - the index corresponding to the Node that will be deleted in the linked list
